title: Payment related
content:
Hello & Namaste,

I do use Thunderbird and find it extremely useful to collate all my emails at one place. I have contributed earlier and would continue to do so. But I do not wish to provide any credit card information for payment, but there are many other ways of paying thru UPI, Net banking, etc which do not ask for any credit card info. Please review your policy and make it convenient for your customers to make quick payments without asking for credit cartd info. Thanks Renukaprasad Belgur
creator: prasadbelgur

title: Thunderbird (macOS) - unify pop3 and imap accounts
content:
Hello there,

I am using Thunderbird 128.11.1esr on macOS Ventura 13.7.6 (OCLP) and would like to have all my accounts displayed in one unified inbox:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-42-32-0314df.png

In the past all my accounts relied on pop3, but now of them changed to imap only, which now shows up like this:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-43-14-1d6721.png

Is there a way for me to have just one inbox folder? I set it up like this ages ago but can't recall which steps need to be taken to receive the desired view.

If I choose View > Folders > Unified folders I get this:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-16-23-45-37-4f8cd1.png

Thanks in advance!
creator: ronfouchier

title: Can't change the background color when replying to html formatted emails, e.g. from support ticket systems
content:
When I receive some special html formatted email e.g. from ticket system like Zendesk they look like this: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-32-c4ca42.png

When I want to reply to the text stays at the blue colored background and the text would be hard to read and it looks ugly: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-37-c81e72.png

Unfortunately I can't change background color to blank or white in Tunderbird 139.0.2. In menu of reply window "Page colors and Background", "Use custom colors", "Background" I can set to #ffffff of course, click apply and ok, but that doesn't change it: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-06-17-01-06-42-eccbc8.png

I suppose it relies to the html formatting of the received email because on starting to write a complete new email it works. But that's very annoying that Thunderbird doesn't manage to change background colors on already formatted html body. Is this a bug or only poor source code and the programmer didn't have much motivation to write and robust code which could gather all html emails?

Could you check with this test email to test and reproduce? https://limewire.com/d/pqbEk#1idjNje6b2

Thanks a lot! I'd be very happy about your help.
creator: riegel

title: There are times when I suddenly cannot receive new emails on Thunderbird.
content: I have set up a Microsoft 365 account in Thunderbird to send and receive emails. Suddenly, I cannot receive new emails on Thunderbird. Even if I manually attempt to send/receive emails, new emails are not received. No error messages are displayed. When I log into Webmail (Outlook), I can see the newly arrived emails. Upon checking with Microsoft, they indicated that the root cause seems to be related to the failure in properly updating the UIDL map and UIDL history. Reinstalling the Thunderbird application did not resolve the issue. Could you please advise on how to address this problem?
creator: itsupport6

title: upgrade notification persists
content: For a few days a banner persists on the lower left of the message window. It obscures content. ""Upgrade to Thunderbird Release"" I have checked twice to make sure there is no update available. Why does this annoying message persist after I run the update. I have rebooted the application multiple times. I do not want to click "Learn more" on the annoying banner promoting "Get monthly updates. with new features and improvements in the new Thunderbird Release" Is it malware? If the application is up to date why are you forcing me to "Learn more"? This is not a good user experience. My MacBook Air is up to date. Thunderbird release 128.11.1esr
creator: dougb2

title: TB fails to recognise or pick an email that has arrived in the server
content:
I find TB (sometimes, rarely perhaps) unable to recognise a mail's arrival although it has arrived. I chanced to discover this because I was expecting one and I kept trying get/fetch mails but kept on receiving the no new message status, but when I logged into the outlook mail server, I saw it there unread. Is there a way to trigger TB or outlook to resend or refresh, so TB can recognise and download it? Ofcourse I can do other things such as forward, reply with cc: etc., on the server but want to preserve the original in the TB folder.

appreciate any help?

thanks Raman

title: Problema apertura messaggi di posta salvati in cartelle di rete.
content:
Buon pomeriggio, è mia abitudine catalogare i messaggi che mi arrivano salvandoli in delle cartelle di rete (precisamente su un NAS di rete). Improvvisamente mi succede che riaprendo i messaggi salvati si apre la finestra di thunderbird completamente bianca. Ho notato che il problema si presenta aprendo la cartella di rete con l'indirizzo IP:

\\Indirizzo IP NAS\cartella condivisa\messaggio.eml -> (Finestra bianca)

Mentre se apro la cartella da risorse di rete, e quindi con il nome del NAS, il messaggio si apre regolarmente:

\\Nome_NAS\cartella condivisa\messaggi.eml -> (Finestra con il messaggio visualizzato)

Quale può essere il problema?

Grazie Giorgio
creator: mejgio

title: After latest update, 139.0.2, can no longer create a new message, clicking on +New Message elicits no response at all. I can reply to emails.
content: I have run Thunderbird for many years, no problem. Updated to version 139.0.2 today. Can no longer compose new email, clicking on +New Message elicits no response at all. Using the 'Send To Mail' no longer works. But I an reply to incoming emails. Turned off ad-ons & troubleshooting mode, turned off antivirus, made sure Thunderbird is a allowed program in antivirus (Avira). Nothing. Checked IMAP & SMTP, nothing changes, as far as I an see. Previous version was 115.

title: Gmail quit after updating password in Gmail
content:
Gmail was working with Oath2, but due to some security issues, I had to update my Google (& thus Gmail) password. It was on a different computer. Started Thunderbird up and it would not do anything with GMail. Some "expert" had said to go into passwords, delete them all for GMail, and it will prompt you for the password, etc. Well, it DID work for sending, but for receiving it just gives an error: "The STAT command did not succeed. Error getting message number and sizes. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: [AUTH] Invalid credentials." And just an "OK" response is possible. 

 What do I need to do to kick start it into working on downloads?
